meanings.definition: To exceed in bulk or size.
meanings.sent1: The pumpkin was outbulking all the other vegetables in the garden.
meanings.sent2: She was outbulking her classmates in height.
meanings.sent3: The elephant thought it was outbulking the tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: The skyscraper outbulked the surrounding buildings.
meanings.sent5: The giant wave outbulked all the others, crashing onto the shore with tremendous force.

meanings.definition: The act of surpassing in bulk or size.
meanings.sent1: The outbulking of the new building made it stand out in the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The outbulking of the ship made it the largest in the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The outbulking of the cake made it impossible to fit in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The outbulking of the tree's roots caused cracks in the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The outbulking of the mountain was a sight to behold, towering over the landscape.
